result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam Joseph Kern

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: EZ. Defendant Adam Joseph Kern in court, in custody.  Attorney Michelle A. Wenninger in court for Adam Joseph Kern.  Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  State and defense do not contest the findings of the competency report.  Atty. Wenninger requests adjournment to discuss position on prelim.  Court accepts Dr. Seipel's report that the defendant is competency and adopt the findings in the report.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Dr Seipel; Confidential per Cover Sheet for Confidential Records filed 10/17/22

Sent to defendant at WC Jail
Emailed to DHS with complaint

Reset Hearing from 9-26-2022 to on October 24, 2022 at 09:30 am for competency report.
D's NCH sent to WC Jail
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. No contact with J.S. and M.S.

Defendant Adam Joseph Kern appeared by video (via Zoom), in custody with Atty. Timothy Drewa by video (via Zoom).  Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. CASE ADJOURNED to allow defendant to  appear in person. RECALLED - Same appearances except defendant appears in person in custody. Court advises defendant of rights. Defendant waived right to atty but then requested atty.  Public defender will follow-up w/defendant to determine if defendant is eligible for representation. Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney. Preliminary hearing time limits waived. Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:15 am.
